column10: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column4: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 4. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column10: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column6: they must not make a right turn.
column8: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column6: show which lanes you must use.
column10: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 8. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 9. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must not drive past this sign.
column8: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column10: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.

column2: 10. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column6: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.

column2: 11. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition and type of vehicle tires.
column6: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.

column2: 12. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 13. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column6: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column8: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column10: stare straight ahead at all times.

column2: 14. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
15. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column6: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column8: you must be aware that the pavementÂ gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column10: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.

column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 18. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column10: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 19. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 24. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column8: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column10: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 25. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column10: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
